title: Chord: 11th in G (Shape: D)
content:
# Chord: 11th in G (Shape: D)

The 11th chord in G played using the D shape on the guitar is a rich and colorful chord voicing that adds depth and complexity to a progression in the key of G. This chord shape features the following notes: G (root), D (5th), F# (7th), A (9th), and C (11th). 

## Notes and Intervals
- G (Root)
- A (9th)
- B (10th missing in this voicing)
- C (11th)
- D (5th)
- F# (7th)

The absence of the 3rd in this voicing gives the chord a "suspended" quality, and the addition of the 9th and 11th creates a lush and jazzy sound that can add a sense of tension and resolution to a progression. 

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This voicing is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and other sophisticated styles of music. It adds a more complex and colorful flavor compared to traditional triads and seventh chords. The 11th chord in G (played using the D shape) can create a dreamy, ethereal atmosphere when used in the right context.

## Example Songs
1. "So What" by Miles Davis
2. "Maiden Voyage" by Herbie Hancock
3. "Spain" by Chick Corea
